page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The area which we are covering consists mainly of countryside. There are no villages. The nearest there is to a village is the cluster of farms at Brierton. The farms in the area are mainly mixed farms. There are 16 in all including 2 chicken farms. Riding is popular and there are 2 riding schools. There is only one one major road through the area. This is the A19 which runs from Newcastle to Teesside. Amenities too are few. There is one public house,the Red Lion, a service station and a car tuning centre. Apart from the riding schools there is no organised recreation but townspeople do use the area for walks.
